summary: The 'Patients’ Right to Know Their Medication Act of 2025' mandates that all prescription drugs include standardized, paper-based patient medication information (PMI). This PMI must be scientifically accurate, in plain language, and include details on usage, side effects, and contact information. The bill directs the Secretary to issue regulations regarding the form, content, and dissemination of this information, aiming to improve patient safety, reduce adverse drug events, and minimize healthcare costs by providing accessible and understandable information about prescribed medications.
